rev.diff:
Line 2: Line 2:
'''Vanna Bonta''' is a novelist, poet and actress best known as the author of ''Flight: A Quantum Fiction Novel'' (Meridian House 1996)<ref>[http://velocityebooks.com/quantum/flight.html Flight: a quantum fiction novel, by Vanna Bonta]; book reviews</ref> the story of an amnesiac girl with no navel, and award-winning collections of poetry as well as for a cameo role as Zed's queen in the fantasy movie ''[[The Beastmaster (film)|The Beastmaster]]''. She is also the inventor of the [[2suit]].<ref>Inventors Digest, May 2009; Issue 25, Vol. 5</ref><ref>[http://www.americanchronicle.com/articles/view/101039 American Chronicle] - May 02, 2009; Vanna Bonta Does Inventor's Digest: New Meaning To Beautiful</ref>
'''Vanna Bonta''' is a novelist, poet and actress best known as the author of ''Flight: A Quantum Fiction Novel'' (Meridian House 1996)<ref>[http://velocityebooks.com/quantum/flight.html Flight: a quantum fiction novel, by Vanna Bonta]; book reviews</ref> the story of an amnesiac girl with no navel, and award-winning collections of poetry as well as for a cameo role as Zed's queen in the fantasy movie ''[[The Beastmaster (film)|The Beastmaster]]''. She is also the inventor of the [[2suit]].<ref>Inventors Digest, May 2009; Issue 25, Vol. 5</ref><ref>[http://www.americanchronicle.com/articles/view/101039 American Chronicle] - May 02, 2009; Vanna Bonta Does Inventor's Digest: New Meaning To Beautiful</ref>
â
Claims to have sat for Florentine artist [[Pietro Annigoni]] as a obese young girl.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1747307/ Pietro Annigoni] biography imdb</ref>
+
Sat for Florentine artist [[Pietro Annigoni]] as a young girl.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1747307/ Pietro Annigoni] biography imdb</ref>
She was a model of Woman for the [[Frederick Hart (sculptor)|Frederick Hart]] work "Creation of Mankind" (Ex Nihilo) on the front entrance of the [[Washington National Cathedral]] in Washington D.C.<ref>[http://www.news-inside.com/1682/the-things-they-say-vanna-bonta.htm News Inside] July 6, 2006</ref>
She was a model of Woman for the [[Frederick Hart (sculptor)|Frederick Hart]] work "Creation of Mankind" (Ex Nihilo) on the front entrance of the [[Washington National Cathedral]] in Washington D.C.<ref>[http://www.news-inside.com/1682/the-things-they-say-vanna-bonta.htm News Inside] July 6, 2006</ref>
â
She appeared in [[List of The Universe episodes|The Universe Season 3 Episode 4 "Sex in Space"]] and babbled about how her [[2suit]] could be used to achieve intimacy in [[microgravity]].<ref>[http://www.nowpublic.com/world/universe-sex-space-marks-new-era-mankind The Universe: Sex in Space Marks New Era For Mankind?] Now Public (December 1, 2008)</ref>
+
